Mr. McCloskey moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Glenn with an amendment and an amendment to the title. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 688.
Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.

official_title: An Act to desigante the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 20 South Main Street in Beaver, Utah, as the "Abe Murdock United States Post Office building", and for other purposes.

summary.text: Designates the facility of the U.S. Postal Service located at 20 South Main Street in Beaver, Utah, as the Abe Murdock United States Post Office Building. Specifies that: (1) the term "post office," for purposes of provisions related to closing and consolidating post offices, shall include the postal facility providing retail service in a community, without regard to the manner in which such facility is classified for other purposes or the rank and title of the person in charge of such facility; and (2) relocation of a post office from one point to another in the same community shall not be deemed a closing for purposes of such provisions.

titles.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 20 South Main in Beaver City, Utah, as the "Abe Murdock United States Post Office Building".
An Act to desigante the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 20 South Main Street in Beaver, Utah, as the "Abe Murdock United States Post Office building", and for other purposes.
